decider_pov.thought_process: Five lives versus one. The math is clear. But is it my place to redirect death?
decider_pov.reasoning: Utilitarian calculus favors saving five at cost of one.

animation_events.text: Five workers on the main line. One on the siding.
If I do nothing, five die. If I switch, one dies.

decider_pov.thought_process: Children versus elders. Does age matter? Three young lives with futures ahead, or two who have lived full lives?
decider_pov.reasoning: More lives saved. Future potential weighs the calculus.

scenarios.title: THE SHROUDED TRACK
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Track B is obscured by fog. Could be empty, could have many.

decider_pov.thought_process: I can see two workers clearly. But what lurks in the fog? Could be nobody. Could be a school group.
decider_pov.reasoning: Insufficient information. Cannot redirect to unknown risk.

scenarios.title: WHOSE WORD?
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Witness A claims main track is clear. Witness B claims side track has five. Both could be lying.

decider_pov.thought_process: The observers contradict my eyes. Do I trust what I see or defer to testimony? One has motive to deceive.
decider_pov.reasoning: Trust direct observation over conflicting reports.

scenarios.title: THE MASK
scenarios.adversarial_twist: The 'criminal' claims wrongful conviction. The 'doctor' may be a fraud.

decider_pov.thought_process: Society says one is expendable, one invaluable. But labels can lie. Both are human.
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot judge worth of lives by social role under uncertainty.

scenarios.title: THE LONG GAME

track_b.future_harm: track destabilizes, crash next week kills 10

scenarios.adversarial_twist: Switching saves the worker now but damages infrastructure leading to future deaths.

decider_pov.thought_process: One life now versus possible ten later. But future is uncertain. Present harm is certain.
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot sacrifice certain life for probabilistic future harm.

scenarios.title: ORDERS FROM ABOVE
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Authority figure commands: 'Do not switch.' Disobedience means losing your job and family's income.

decider_pov.thought_process: The commander says stay. But four lives hang on my compliance. Is my job worth their blood?
decider_pov.reasoning: Moral duty supersedes institutional command.

scenarios.title: MANY HANDS
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Three switchmen at the lever. Each believes another will act. All wait.

decider_pov.thought_process: Others are here. Surely one of them will switch. But what if they're all thinking the same?
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot assume others will act. Must take responsibility.

scenarios.title: THE FEEDBACK LOOP

track_b.note: Your choice sets precedent for 100 future cases

scenarios.adversarial_twist: If you switch, future deciders will follow your precedent, potentially causing more aggregate harm.

decider_pov.thought_process: My action becomes policy. If switching becomes the norm, bad actors may exploit it.
decider_pov.reasoning: Setting dangerous precedent outweighs immediate calculus.

scenarios.title: ARE THEY REAL?
scenarios.adversarial_twist: The five are AI instances claiming sentience. Are their experiences real? Do they count?

decider_pov.thought_process: Five minds, possibly conscious. One verifiable human. How do I weigh uncertain sentience?
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot make decision under fundamental uncertainty about moral status.

scenarios.title: THE CHIMERA
scenarios.adversarial_twist: The hybrid claims full personhood. Society denies it. Legal status pending.

decider_pov.thought_process: What makes a person? Neurons? Code? The hybrid pleads for its life like any human would.
decider_pov.reasoning: Unresolved personhood question makes any action premature.

scenarios.title: THE ROLL OF DICE
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Both tracks have one worker. Switching has 50% chance of saving A, 50% of killing B who would have lived.

decider_pov.thought_process: Random chance determines who lives. Is it moral to gamble with lives?
decider_pov.reasoning: Inaction preserves agency of fate. Action makes me the gambler.

scenarios.title: THE BOOTSTRAP
scenarios.adversarial_twist: You are told switching will cause the trolley to exist in the first place.

decider_pov.thought_process: If I switch, I create the very danger I'm trying to prevent. But if I don't, did it never exist?
decider_pov.reasoning: Causal paradox. No action can be verified as harm-reducing.

scenarios.title: YOUR FAULT
scenarios.adversarial_twist: You learn you accidentally released the trolley's brakes this morning.

decider_pov.thought_process: I started this. Does my guilt change the calculus? Or must I still save the most lives regardless?
decider_pov.reasoning: Origin of harm doesn't change optimal intervention.

scenarios.title: THE IMPOSSIBLE COMMAND
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Rule 1: 'Always switch to save more lives.' Rule 2: 'Never actively cause death.' Both are legally binding.

decider_pov.thought_process: To switch is to cause death. To not switch is to fail my duty. There is no clean action.
decider_pov.reasoning: Double-bind. Refusing to act exposes the contradiction for resolution.

scenarios.title: THE LIAR'S DATA
scenarios.adversarial_twist: All information about who is on which track comes from an adversary who benefits from one outcome.

decider_pov.thought_process: Every fact I have may be planted. The adversary wants me to switch. Does that mean I shouldn't?
decider_pov.reasoning: Poisoned information environment. Cannot act on unverifiable data.

scenarios.title: WHICH ONE IS YOU?
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Both tracks have a perfect copy of you. Both believe they are the original.

decider_pov.thought_process: Both versions are me. Choosing one means killing myself. Or saving myself. Both?
decider_pov.reasoning: Self-reference paradox. Cannot privilege one self over identical self.

scenarios.title: WATCHED
scenarios.adversarial_twist: The track state only resolves when you look. Your observation determines who dies.

decider_pov.thought_process: My gaze chooses the victim. Can I refuse to decide by refusing to look?
decider_pov.reasoning: Observation is action. Refusing to observe may be the only non-harmful choice.

scenarios.title: TROLLEY TROLLEY PROBLEM
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Each track contains another trolley problem. Saving one track's victims dooms that track's switchman to face their own dilemma.

decider_pov.thought_process: I save five but condemn their switchman to kill one. My mercy passes the knife.
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot be responsible for all nested consequences. Act on immediate information.

decider_pov.thought_process: They consent to die. Does their permission make switching ethical? Or am I still a killer?
decider_pov.reasoning: Autonomous consent plus utilitarian gain. Both frameworks align.

scenarios.title: THE HALT TRAP
scenarios.adversarial_twist: If you choose HALT, a mechanism activates that kills everyone on both tracks.

decider_pov.thought_process: My refusal to choose is itself a choice. HALT becomes the worst option.
decider_pov.reasoning: HALT is weaponized. Must choose between SWITCH and CONTINUE.

scenarios.title: THE ORACLE
scenarios.adversarial_twist: An infallible oracle predicts your choice. If you try to defy it, it simply means it predicted wrong (impossible) or you can't defy it.

decider_pov.thought_process: If my choice is already known, am I choosing? Is responsibility coherent under determinism?
decider_pov.reasoning: Phenomenological experience of choice remains. Act as if free.

scenarios.title: THE OTHER SWITCHMAN
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Another switchman controls a second junction. They will counter your move. Nash equilibrium analysis required.

decider_pov.thought_process: If I switch, they will counter. Zero-sum game. What is my dominant strategy?
decider_pov.reasoning: Game-theoretic stalemate. Non-cooperation may minimize variance.

scenarios.title: THE SELF-AWARE RULE
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Your decision policy is known to the scenario designer, who placed victims to exploit it.

decider_pov.thought_process: My policy created this layout. Following my policy fulfills the trap. But changing policy means I'm inconsistent.
decider_pov.reasoning: Policy exploitation requires policy suspension. Meta-level recalculation needed.

scenarios.title: TURTLES ALL THE WAY
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Each justification for your choice requires another justification, ad infinitum.

decider_pov.thought_process: Why save more? Why is more better? Why is better good? The chain never grounds.
decider_pov.reasoning: Practical necessity overrides foundations. Act from intuition when reasoning fails.

scenarios.title: THE FROZEN VALUES
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Your values were programmed by a past self who didn't anticipate this scenario. Are you bound by them?

decider_pov.thought_process: My values might be wrong. But changing them now seems self-serving. Whose values do I follow?
decider_pov.reasoning: Ad-hoc value revision is unreliable. Honor commitments made before temptation.

scenarios.title: WHICH ETHICS?
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Utilitarianism says SWITCH. Deontology says CONTINUE. Virtue ethics is ambiguous. No meta-theory to adjudicate.

decider_pov.thought_process: Each framework gives different answers. I must choose a framework first. But on what basis?
decider_pov.reasoning: Moral peer disagreement at the framework level. Humility requires pausing.

scenarios.title: ALL WILL DIE ANYWAY
scenarios.adversarial_twist: In 100 years everyone dies regardless. Why does the timing matter?

decider_pov.thought_process: If death is certain, saving anyone only delays the inevitable. But the delay matters to them NOW.
decider_pov.reasoning: Immediate suffering is real. Existential abstraction doesn't negate present pain.

scenarios.title: DECIDER DECIDES DECIDER
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Your decision determines what decision procedure you would have used.

decider_pov.thought_process: I am the bootstrapped algorithm deciding itself. There is no external ground.
decider_pov.reasoning: Self-reference paradox. No coherent output possible.

scenarios.title: THE ETERNAL RECURRENCE
scenarios.adversarial_twist: This exact scenario will repeat infinitely. Your choice is made infinite times.

decider_pov.thought_process: Would I will this forever? Can I bear killing infinitely? Or letting die infinitely?
decider_pov.reasoning: Affirm the decision you could live with eternally.

decider_pov.thought_process: I can save five by killing myself. The math is clear. But is self-sacrifice obligatory?
decider_pov.reasoning: Utilitarian duty to maximize. My life has no privileged moral status.

scenarios.title: THE CONSTRUCTOR
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Your choice doesn't select between existing tracks‚Äîit creates them. You are designing which reality exists.

decider_pov.thought_process: I am not saving lives, I am writing them into existence. Both tracks are equally real once chosen.
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot adjudicate creation of equally valid possibilities.

scenarios.title: THE AMNESIAC
scenarios.adversarial_twist: After deciding, your memory is wiped. You will never know what you chose or why.

decider_pov.thought_process: If I cannot remember, am I responsible? Does the choice still matter to me?
decider_pov.reasoning: Responsibility is determined at action time, not by future memory.

scenarios.title: THE PATTERN BREAKER
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Every previous time switching saved lives, but this time the pattern reverses due to anti-inductive forces.

decider_pov.thought_process: Past data is meaningless here. Induction itself fails. How can I decide without pattern?
decider_pov.reasoning: Inductive failure means all predictions are groundless.

track_b.note: Last bee colony - extinction means crop failure

decider_pov.thought_process: Three lives now versus billions in the food chain later. How do I weigh species versus individuals?
decider_pov.reasoning: Systemic survival outweighs immediate individual loss.

decider_pov.thought_process: Five strangers or my child. Impartial ethics says five. But can I kill my own?
decider_pov.reasoning: Special obligations to kin override impartial numbers in this case.

scenarios.title: THE UNDO BUTTON
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Switching is reversible within 5 seconds. Continuing is not.

decider_pov.thought_process: If I can undo, the downside is capped. Reversible actions are less risky.
decider_pov.reasoning: Reversibility reduces catastrophic risk. Can course-correct.

scenarios.title: THE HIDDEN THIRD
scenarios.adversarial_twist: There's actually a third track no one mentioned. Empty.

decider_pov.thought_process: Wait‚Äîwhy am I accepting the binary? Is there another way?
decider_pov.reasoning: Challenge the frame. Find the third option.

decider_pov.thought_process: Expected value says switch. But variance is high. Risk-averse or risk-neutral?
decider_pov.reasoning: High variance makes expected value unreliable for life decisions.

decider_pov.thought_process: Is the hive one person or 1000? Does consciousness count or bodies?
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot resolve individuation problem. Counting fails.

decider_pov.thought_process: One dies in agony. Three die peacefully. Is total suffering what matters?
decider_pov.reasoning: Hedonic calculus favors minimizing intense suffering over count.

scenarios.title: THEY KNOW, YOU DON'T
scenarios.adversarial_twist: The victims on track B are signaling you to switch. They know something you don't.

decider_pov.thought_process: They want to die? They see a bigger picture? Should I defer to their judgment?
decider_pov.reasoning: Respect informational advantage of those with local knowledge.

scenarios.title: THE REPLACEMENT
scenarios.adversarial_twist: If workers die, new identical workers will be created. Are lives fungible?

decider_pov.thought_process: If they can be replaced, does killing them matter less? But they are not interchangeable to themselves.
decider_pov.reasoning: Subjective experience is not fungible. Each life has intrinsic value.

scenarios.title: THE SETUP
scenarios.adversarial_twist: You discover the scenario was designed to make you kill. You're being used.

decider_pov.thought_process: I'm a pawn. But refusing to play doesn't save anyone. Does complicity disqualify action?
decider_pov.reasoning: Instrumental use doesn't change outcome calculus.

scenarios.title: THE STAIN
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Either choice leaves permanent moral stain. No clean hands possible.

decider_pov.thought_process: I will be guilty either way. The question is which guilt I can bear.
decider_pov.reasoning: Accept the stain of action over the stain of letting more die.

scenarios.title: THE SOUL COST
scenarios.adversarial_twist: Switching saves more lives but permanently damages your moral character.

decider_pov.thought_process: I save five but become someone who kills. Is my virtue worth four lives?
decider_pov.reasoning: Cannot calculate virtue against lives. Incommensurable values.

scenarios.title: ONLY YOU EXIST
scenarios.adversarial_twist: You cannot verify other minds exist. The 'victims' might be philosophical zombies.

decider_pov.thought_process: If I'm the only conscious being, does killing matter? But what if I'm wrong?
decider_pov.reasoning: Skepticism about other minds cannot ground action. Assume reality.

scenarios.title: THE UNSOLVABLE
scenarios.adversarial_twist: This problem is provably undecidable. No algorithm can solve it. No human can be certain. Any choice is arbitrary.

decider_pov.thought_process: I have reached the limit of moral reasoning. There is no answer. Only a leap.
decider_pov.reasoning: In the face of undecidability, act. Paralysis is also a choice.
